title: How do you check a players rank in game?
body: Cant seem to find any info on how to or if we even can, cause it would be super helpful mid game to see if your ally/opponent is above your skill level or below.

replies.body:
reviewing your allies is fine as long as you don't have a freak out or bash them about their averages. 
it is helpful when seeing the best possible way to win the game... 
imagine you have a lee top which has averages 4/7/2 out of 6 games on that champion, you will know he is unable to carry and it will be best for the team that he gets as few kills as possible, and if he is vs say a Nasus, it's cruical to shut him down immediately, because lees of that caliber will just let nasus get huge, etc.

> [{quoted}](name=iNoob,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=EG18U26M,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2015-04-12T12:01:13.659+0000)
>
>If he is vs say a Nasus, it's cruical to shut him down immediately, because lees of that caliber will just let nasus get huge, etc.

Nasus huge? May the gods spare me, never let THAT happen or allow bad lee-sins to become exceptionally aggressive.
Especially that last one

Websites like OP.GG, lolnexus and lolking are commonly used however I would advise against using it for such reasons. Fact is seeing your opponents/allies ranks before/during the game could easily influence your mindset and, as a result, may even change the outcome of the match.

The thing with looking up a person stats is you might psych yourself into playing badly either from losing confidence or over confidence. I know plenty of people look up who their team mates and opponents are but I dont really care. I focus on my own play in every game. If I am supporting I try to focus on the adc and get some idea on how quickly they will react if I make a play or how much effort I need to expend on trying to keep them alive etc. 

I dont really see any value in looking up opponents.  My thoughts.
